nodes.documentation:
@notice
A user does not have to interact with the setVerse function to store a Bible verse in
this contract. This fallback method allows a user to simply send ETH at least equal to
the versePrice, at which point a Provable query will be fired to fetch a random Bible
verse.

nodes.documentation:
@notice
A user does not have to interact with the setVerse function to store a Bible verse in
this contract. This fallback method allows a user to simply send ETH at least equal to
the versePrice, at which point a Provable query will be fired to fetch a random Bible
verse.

devdoc.author: John Wall, Ealdorman, Inc.
devdoc.details: The oracle used here is provided by Provable at provable.xyz

__callback(bytes32,string).details: This function is limited to calls from Provable

params.myid: The query ID provided by Provable
params.result: The result provided by Provable from the query

params.book: The book name, all of which are listed in the books array
params.chapter: A chapter number, expressed as a string
params.verse: A verse number, express as a string

getVerse(string,string,string).return: Returns a verse's text if it has been stored

params.result: A string retrieved from a Provable query

setProvableGasLimit(uint256).details: Because we're dealing with long strings, gas can be quite high

params._provableGasLimit: An unsigned integer, denominated in gwei

params.concatenatedReference: A Bible verse in the form of book/chapter/verse, i.e. John/3/16

params._versePrice: The price a user must pay to store a verse, denominated in wei

devdoc.title: Preserves verses from the KJV Bible on the blockchaib

setProvableGasLimit(uint256).notice: Sets the gas limit of a Provable query

setVerse(string).notice: Takes a concatenated Bible verse reference and creates an oracle query

withdraw().notice: The contract's creator may withdraw any ETh accumulated in excess of Provable fees

userdoc.notice: Use this contract to store and retrieve Bible verses
